intro: Evansia cristata, commonly known as the crested spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Evansia cristata is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient plant in harsh desert conditions.
